Detailed Description

A class to manipulate AVL trees.

File to include to provide access to the routines for special manipulation of AVL trees in module P_AVL.C. The remaining functions must be provided by the module P_Stree.C (binary search tree subroutines).

Notes: AVL trees are balanced trees: a tree is balanced if for each node the depths of its two subtrees differ in at most 1. Use only if information recovery is considerably more frequent than insertion.

See also:
P_AVL.c , P_stree.h , P_stree.c
Author:
J. R. Valverde
Date:
8-Apr-1990

Function Documentation

avl_delete (  avl_tree *    tree,
item_t *    item,
int(*    compare)(),
bool *    h
) 
 

Delete a key from an AVL tree.

If the requested key was not found in the tree, h will be set to FALSE.

Parameters:
tree  The AVL tree to operate upon.
item  The item to remove.
compare  A function to compare two items in the tree.
h  A flag set to TRUE to find out if the key was in the tree.

void avl_insert (  avl_tree *    tree,
item_t *    item,
int(*    compare)(),
bool *    h
) 
 

Search+Insert a value in an AVL tree.

If the item is already stored in the tree, sets h to TRUE. If the item is not in the tree, store it. To actually search without inserting the key, use the generic binary tree functions.

Parameters:
tree  The AVL tree to operate upon.
item  The item to search/store.
compare  A function to compare two items in the tree.
h  A flag set to FALSE to find out if the key was in the tree.
Warning:
The root of the tree might change (?) in this process. P will keep pointing to it in any case. We should return a pointer to the deleted key so it can be freed by the caller. This is horriby inefficient since the key must be passed through all the recursive calls.
